translated: The Monastic Code of the Elders
The Great Analysis🔽The chapter on training rules
1. The training rule on making a slurping noise

original: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṁ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
analyzed: tena samayena buddhaḥ bhagavā sāvatthiyam viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme
translated: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, the Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery

original: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū capucapukārakaṁ bhuñjanti …pe…
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyāḥ bhikkhū capucapukārakam bhuñjanti pe
translated: on one occasion the monks from the group of six made a slurping noise while eating. …

analyzed: na capucapukārakam bhuñjissāmi iti sikkhā karaṇīyā ati
translated: “‘I will not make a slurping noise while eating,’ this is how you should train.”
One should not make a slurping noise while eating.

original: Yo anādariyaṁ paṭicca capucapukārakaṁ bhuñjati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.🔽Anāpatti—🔽asañcicca …pe…🔽ādikammikassāti.
analyzed: yaḥ anādariyam paṭicca capu capu kārakam bhuñjati āpatti dukkaṭassa  anāpatti  a san cit ca pe  ādikammikassa ati
translated: If a monk, out of disrespect, makes a slurping noise while eating, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
There is no offense if it is unintentional, if he is not thinking, if he is asleep, if he is the first offender.🔽The tenth training rule is finished.
The fifth sub-chapter on lumps is finished.
